alert.note: Alert for Edgecombe (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 14 at 8:35AM EST until January 19 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... Tar River At Tarboro affecting Edgecombe County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Neuse River At Smithfield affecting Johnston County. Lower Roanoke River At Roanoke Rapids affecting Northampton and Halifax Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tar River at Tarboro. * WHEN...Until late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, The river is at bankfull. At 19.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. The Riverside Park and River Road at the US64 bridge flood. At 20.0 feet, Lowland flooding begins south of Daniel Street in east Tarboro. At 24.0 feet, Moderate flooding begins. River Road in Tarboro is underwater and flooding begins on east Wilson and St David Streets. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM EST Sunday the stage was 18.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 19.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 22.1 feet Tuesday evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.2 feet on 04/02/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Thu Tar River Tarboro 19.0 18.7 Sun 8 am EST 20.1 21.7 21.7 20.3 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued this evening at 845 PM EST.
